Name: loudoun_2008_lcpssites_point
LayerDisplayName: Public School Sites, Loudoun County, VA 2008
Originator: Loudoun County, Virginia, Department of Building and Development
OriginatorSort: Loudoun County, Virginia, Department of Building and Development
Abstract: This point data set is used to identify the locations of Loudoun County Public School (LCPS) sites.  The points are the center of parcels owned or operated by LCPS. These sites contain existing school location or proffered school locations.
FgdcText:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>

    </citation>
    <descript>
      <abstract>This point data set is used to identify the locations of Loudoun County Public School (LCPS) sites.  The points are the center of parcels owned or operated by LCPS. These sites contain existing school location or proffered school locations.</abstract>
      <purpose>This data set is used to store and track the locations of existing schools and proffered sites.</purpose>
      <supplinf>Site points were collected from the label points of parcel polygons.  They were then adjusted to fall within the building footprint, for possible use with the building layer.
Data are stored in the corporate ArcSDE Geodatabase as a point feature class.  The coordinate system is Virginia State Plane (North), Zone 4501, datum NAD83 HARN (vertical datum, if applicable, NAVD88), US Survey foot units.</supplinf>
    </descript>

        </sngdate>
      </timeinfo>

    </timeperd>

      <progress>Complete</progress>

    </status>

Acknowledgement of Loudoun County and Loudoun County Public Schools would be appreciated in products derived from this data.</useconst>

    <attracc>
      <attraccr>Retention of attribute accuracy throughout the coverage to geodatabase feature class coversion process was ensured by a QA/QC programmatic check. To meet satisfactory QA/QC requirements the input coverage and output feature class must have, on a record by record basis, identical attribution when comparing all concatenated fields to all the user-defined attribution.</attraccr>
    </attracc>
    <logic>Topologically clean</logic>
    <complete>Features may have been eliminated or generalized due to scale and intended use. To assist Loudoun County, Virginia in the maintenance of the data, please provide any information concerning discovered errors, omissions, or other discrepancies found in the data.</complete>
    <posacc>
      <horizpa>
        <horizpar>Retention of coordinate accuracy throughout the coverage to geodatabase feature class conversion process was ensured by a QA/QC programmatic check. To meet satisfactory QA/QC requirements the input coverage and output feature class must have the same record total, and on a record by record basis, area, perimeter, and length differential of less than +/- 0.5%.</horizpar>
      </horizpa>
      <vertacc>
        <vertaccr>A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.</vertaccr>
      </vertacc>
    </posacc>

      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Label points of Loudoun County Public School (LCPS) parcels were converted into point locations.  These points were then adjusted to fall within the building footprint for the school or property.</procdesc>
        <procdate>March 2003</procdate>
        <proccont>
          <cntinfo>
            <cntorgp>
              <cntorg>Loudoun County, VA, Office of Mapping and Geographic Information (OMAGI)</cntorg>
            </cntorgp>
            <cntaddr>
              <addrtype/>
              <address/>
              <city/>
              <state/>
              <postal/>
            </cntaddr>
            <cntvoice>(703) 771-5778</cntvoice>
            <cntfax>(703) 771-5075</cntfax>
          </cntinfo>
        </proccont>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>This data set was part of a batch process that converted legacy data from ArcInfo coverage in Librarian to a single-tiled ArcInfo coverage in preparation for a final coversion to ArcSDE Geodatabase Feature Classes. Data were extracted from Librarian using the EXTRACT TOPOLOGICAL command.

Multi-tiled data sets were extracted into multiple coverages and then combined based on the feature type(s). Layers with both polygon and arc feature classes were processed with the Arc commands, MAPJOIN and DISSOLVE. Arc feature classes alone were processed with the Arc commands, APPEND and DISSOLVE. Layers with both arc and point feature classes and point feature classes alone were processed with the Arc command, APPEND.  When used, the Arc command, DISSOLVE, was given with the <#all> option.

All coverages were then reprojected to HARN 83 using the following .prj file specifications: 
INPUT
PROJECTION STATEPLANE
UNITS FEET
ZONE 5551
DATUM NAD27 NADCON
PARAMETERS
OUTPUT
PROJECTION STATEPLANE
UNITS FEET
FIPSZONE 4501
DATUM HPGN NADCON
PARAMETERS END
			   
This dataset was then converted to a feature class in a geodatabase in ArcSDE.</procdesc>
        <procdate>2004</procdate>
        <proccont>
          <cntinfo>
            <cntorgp>
              <cntorg>Loudoun County, VA, OMAGI</cntorg>
            </cntorgp>
            <cntpos>GIS Analyst</cntpos>
            <cntaddr>
              <addrtype/>
              <address/>
              <city/>
              <state/>
              <postal/>
            </cntaddr>
            <cntvoice/>
          </cntinfo>
        </proccont>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>This school sites layer has the potential to be updated before the beginning of the current school year with new school sites. This is due to new schools being opened for the new school year.</procdesc>
        <procdate>On-going</procdate>
        <proccont>
          <cntinfo>
            <cntorgp>

            </cntorgp>
            <cntpos>GIS Analyst</cntpos>

            </cntaddr>
            <cntvoice/>
          </cntinfo>
        </proccont>
      </procstep>

        <procdate>unknown</procdate>
      </procstep>
